Package lab1.cscd210methods

Class CSCD210Lab1Methods

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab1.cscd210methods.CSCD210Lab1Methods
  • public class CSCD210Lab1Methods
extends java.lang.Object
    The class contains a set of methods required for the lab to work properly
    NOTE:
    All parameters passed to method must be passed as final. You don't need to write a default value constructor since we don't have any class level variable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CSCD210Lab1Methods()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static Book[] addBook​(Book[] array, Book aBook)
      The addBook method makes a new array of the old size plus one
      Next it copies the books from the old array to the new array
      Next it adds the new book in last index of the new array
      static Book createBook​(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The createBook method prompts the user to enter title, isbn, pages, and author.
      static Book[] fillArray​(java.util.Scanner fin, int total)
      The fillArray method first creates an array of books, and then fills each index of the book array with a new Book object.
      static int menu​(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The menu method offers the user a choice from:
      1) Print the books to the screen
      2) Print the books to a file
      3) Sort the books based on natural order
      4) Sort the books based on total order
      5) Add a new book to the bookshelf
      6) Search the bookshelf for a book
      7) Quit
      static void printBooks​(Book[] array, java.io.PrintStream output)
      The printBooks calls the toString method of book and prints each book out followed by a CR
      static java.lang.String readOutputFilename​(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The readOutputFilename calls the readString to read a output filename
      private static java.lang.String readString​(java.lang.String type, java.util.Scanner kb)
      The readString reads a string from the keyboard and ensures the string is not null or empty

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • CSCD210Lab1Methods

        public CSCD210Lab1Methods()

    • Method Detail

      • fillArray

        public static Book[] fillArray​(java.util.Scanner fin,
                               int total)
        The fillArray method first creates an array of books, and then fills each index of the book array with a new Book object.
        Parameters:
        fin - Representing the Scanner object to the file
        total - Representing the total number of elements to be contained in the array
        Returns:
        Book [] Representing array filled with Book objects
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fin is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if total is < 1
        NOTE:
        The file contents are comma separated values in the order title, isbn, pages, authors

      • printBooks

        public static void printBooks​(Book[] array,
                              java.io.PrintStream output)
        The printBooks calls the toString method of book and prints each book out followed by a CR
        Parameters:
        array - Representing the array of books
        output - Representing the PrintStream object to the screen or the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array is null or the length is < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if output stream is null

      • menu

        public static int menu​(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The menu method offers the user a choice from:
        1) Print the books to the screen
        2) Print the books to a file
        3) Sort the books based on natural order
        4) Sort the books based on total order
        5) Add a new book to the bookshelf
        6) Search the bookshelf for a book
        7) Quit
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        int Representing the menu choice which is ensured by you to be between 1 and 7 inclusive
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        NOTE:
        You must ensure the input buffer is empty at the end of the method

      • addBook

        public static Book[] addBook​(Book[] array,
                             Book aBook)
        The addBook method makes a new array of the old size plus one
        Next it copies the books from the old array to the new array
        Next it adds the new book in last index of the new array
        Parameters:
        array - Representing the old array to be copied
        aBook - Representing the book to add to the array
        Returns:
        Book [] Representing the new array with the old books copied over and the new book in the last index of the new array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array is null or length < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aBook is null
        NOTE:
        You must ensure the input buffer is empty at the end of the method

      • createBook

        public static Book createBook​(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The createBook method prompts the user to enter title, isbn, pages, and author. Entering the information is done by the private method readString. The method must ensure that the pages is > 0
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        Book Representing a new Book object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        NOTE:
        You must ensure the input buffer is empty at the end of the method

      • readOutputFilename

        public static java.lang.String readOutputFilename​(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readOutputFilename calls the readString to read a output filename
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        String Representing the output filename
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        NOTE:
        You must ensure the input buffer is empty at the end of the method

      • readString

        private static java.lang.String readString​(java.lang.String type,
                                           java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readString reads a string from the keyboard and ensures the string is not null or empty
        Parameters:
        type - Representing a String for the prompt on what to enter
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        String Representing the appropriate String
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        NOTE:
        You must ensure the input buffer is empty at the end of the method
